description:
We will give you an introduction to Lean Startup (Eric Ries, 2011), explaining you the difference with the more classical approaches of launching a new product or new business.
This seminar will give you the opportunity to understand the basics of Lean Startup & a number of tools used (like the Business Model Canvas).


This introductory evening will also give you hints whether a more in-depth dive in the Lean Startup approach during the weekend of 14 December is your cup-of-tea. Finally, from next year on, we will organise follow-up sessions for Lean Startup believers (whether 'baptised' in December or already convinced earlier).


This intro session will take place in Sint-Niklaas, because of its central location in Flanders. The exact location will be communicated to you in due time.

The evening will start at 18:00 Hrs & finish at 21:30 Hrs. 

18.00 : Doors open


18.30 : Start reception

19.00 : Lean Startup & Business Model Canvas – what is it ?

19.45 : Testimonials

20.15 : Break

20.40 : Business Model Validation & Problem Interviews

21.30: End

Small appetizers will be foreseen !!!
name: Intro Lean Startup & Business Model Canvas

description:
Hi Everyone,

Hope you are all doing well. All the best for 2014 !

I hope a lot of your professional & private ventures come to fruition this year.

It has been too long (last November) since we had our first Lean Startup Flanders (kick-off) evening.

High time for a new evening.

So ... this is what we came up with:

We would like to organise a “Canvas Café”: a World Café on the topic of the Business Model Canvas.

For those not acquainted with the concept of a World Café: a World Café is 'a type of business workshop which aims to provide an open and creative conversation on a topic of mutual interest to surface the collective knowledge, share ideas and insights, and gain a deeper understanding of the subject and the issues involved'.

More specifically: 

- As many attendees as possible bring their Business Model Canvas (or their Lean Canvas) mapping out a business idea they are working on or have affinity with.

- We will have as much discussion tables as we have entrepreneurs with Canvases. 

- Each of these entrepreneurs will be the host of his/her table, welcoming other attendees. 

- The host will first explain his/her Canvas to the attendees. Then the table visitors can provide any valuable feedback/questions/tips during an interactive conversation, lead by the host. The host will visualise the feedback on the paper Canvas. 

- After a given amount of time, everybody switches to another table – except the host.

- The end result of a full cycle is an entrepreneur with an enriched Canvas & the other participants that learned a lot

Depending on the number of ‘equiped’ enterpreneurs (with a canvas), we will have multiple World Café cycles. We will make sure at least 1 coach (= Business Modeler with experience) is present at each table.

So, please join us January 29th at 18.30pm in Antwerp (at Idealabs) as (preferably 'equiped') enterpreneur or lean startup coach. If you could please RSVP on Meetup to let us know if you will be able to attend, as we will have some snacks and refreshments for those who are available to come. I'm sure you won't mind contributing to the catering costs (10 € - to be paid at the entrance).

Important: at the start of the evening, we will give an intro of a half an hour on the Business Model Canvas/Lean Canvas for the non-equiped/non-knowledgeable. If you RSVP, let us know if you will come with or without a filled-in canvas.


If you have any questions, please let us know!

Cheers,

Carl, Nicolas & Frank
name: Canvas Café

description:
The Customer Development approach in Lean Startup is built on a foundation of one-on-one customer interviews. It is trying to get to the bottom of the issue, something that can’t easily be achieved using surveys or website analytics or complaint forums or even focus groups. It is letting your potential customer talk you through the problem and how it affects their life, peeling it back one layer at a time.

The point of these interviews – to learn.

You don’t push anything, sell anything or even try to convince. You are there to learn, to let you eyes be opened to unexpected and unforeseen possibilities. 

Let's learn together  in Ghent about how Problem Interviews should be handled!

There is no need to prepare on forehand. You do not need to have an own case at hand. This time, the skills will be applied on 1 specific topic, common to all.

LEAN STARTUP NOVICES CAN JOIN AT 18.00 HRS FOR A LEAN STARTUP CRASH COURSE PERMITTING THEM TO FOLLOW THIS PROBLEM INTERVIEWS  EVENING EFFORTLESS.

So no problem if you missed one of the previous Lean Startup Flanders seminars!
name: Lean Startup: The Problem Interview (also for LS novices !)

description:
This time, we will make it a fully interactive session with a broad focus.


We will share our experiences concerning our innovation endeavors with eachother.


Since this is a Lean Startup group , we will also try to figure out how Lean Startup techniques could have helped or could still help to face/solve the challenge.

Don't wait too long to inscribe for this one.

The location is a cosy place in mind in Mechelen (no business center this time), which can comfortably host 13 people. Intimate & interactive !
name: Your Innovation Challenges - LS to the rescue !?
